sub_title: Environment, Climate Change Adaptation (CCA), Development, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Security,  Climate-induced Mobility
summary:
I am a passionate Climate and Environmental Advisor with more than ten years of experience in environment, climate change, climate risk assessment, and Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) with a good understanding of climate security as well as migration and displacement in relation to the environment, climate change, and natural hazards in a conflict-affected and fragile country. For more than four years, I was working on climate and conflict analysis at the local level and how natural hazards exacerbated by climate change, environmental degradation and limited adaptation capacities have severe consequences for the livelihoods, food security, and well-being of vulnerable communities and are among the main drivers of displacement and conflict in fragile and conflict-affected states (FCAS).

I have project managerial and technical experience in conflict sensitivity analysis and the environmental and climate dimensions of peace and security, strategy formulation, delivery of project activities, including workshops and output documents, environmental and social impact assessment (ESIA) studies, stakeholder engagements, water resources, fieldwork; institutional capacity-building programs. I also have an understanding of the institutional and political context and exposure to the national and regional climate & environmental policies, and the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction (SFDRR). During this working experience, I designed and implemented interventions that address the complex dynamics of climate change-induced displacement and migration. have managed various groups of professionals and I have developed good team working and leadership skills. I have explored the impact of climate change and environmental degradation on community cohesion, human security, conflict, and mobility patterns and decisions as well as how actors can increase their understanding of the links between those components and can access data and information to support their policy and programmatic responses. The impact of climate change and natural hazards on public health is an area of my interest.

Other key skills include analytical thinking, planning, organizing, problem-solving, knowledge sharing, communication, and interpersonal skills as well as successful experience working with multi-disciplinary teams.

projects:
[{'title': 'Increasing the Knowledge Base on Community Cohesion and Mobility Dynamics in the Context of Climate Change and Environmental Degradation Through Select Country-Based Case Studies Within the MENA Region, Sudan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': 'The project aims to enhance the evidence base on how climate change and environmental degradation have impacted social relationships at the community level and mobility decisions. Although the project will adopt a regional perspective, the study, and primary data collection efforts, will concentrate on areas in Libya and Sudan. This will contribute to informing policies and programs that help communities’ resilience-building and adaptation efforts while supporting the design of effective policies and responses.   
	The main outcome of the project is that key actors (including states, UN agencies, and civil society organizations) utilize actionable, evidence-based recommendations to support improved policy and programming related to the impacts of climate change and environmental degradation on community cohesion and mobility.   
The project’s principal outputs include research documents exploring the impact of climate change and environmental degradation on community cohesion and mobility dynamics and key actors have an increased understanding of the links between climate change and environmental degradation, human security, community cohesion dynamics, and mobility patterns and decisions, and can access data and information to support their policy and programmatic responses.  
Activities:
As part of an interdisciplinary and multinational team, the below activities were performed:
•	Conduct a review of literature on the links between climate change and other key topics (i.e., conflict, community cohesion, water scarcity, mobility, etc.) in Sudan;
•	Communication of the project findings with relevant stakeholders.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sara', 'last_name': 'Elkhalifa', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Environment, Climate Change Adaptation (CCA), Development, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Security,  Climate-induced Mobility'}]}, {'title': 'Providing Technical and Capacity Building Support to the Government of Sudan and Local Communities on Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency Preparedness', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'Contribute to minimizing risks and impacts of floods and droughts in Sudan, by developing national capacities in preparedness for response whilst strengthening community-based risk reduction mechanisms and solutions at the local level. 
Financing Agency/Donor: USAID/ BHA  
Project locations: Kassala and Gadaref, Blue Nile, North Darfur, South Darfur States, Sudan
Activities performed:
•	Identify the stakeholders
•	Provide environmental input in project documents;
•	Conduct national DRR technical review sessions including all related stakeholders including government, UN, INGOs, NGOs, and academia at national and states level;
•	Develop comprehensive community assessment including community hazard and resource mapping;
•	Conduct community meeting;
•	Conduct community workshops;
•	Conduct technical general observation; 
•	Proposing of adaptation action plans;
•	Develop and implement disaster risk reduction (DRR) evidence-based solutions.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sara', 'last_name': 'Elkhalifa', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Environment, Climate Change Adaptation (CCA), Development, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Security,  Climate-induced Mobility'}]}, {'title': 'Design of small wastewater treatment systems', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Main project features:
The scope of the project is to design different sizes of wastewater treatment systems for households and small residential complex.
The specific objectives underlying the overall objective which client had achieved under the contract of the consultancy services
were the following:
 To design septic tanks with different sizes (3 sizes) to provide an environment for solids to settle and possibly undergo anaerobic
decomposition;
 Design different types of manholes;
 Submit a detailed structural design (with shop drawings) for each size of septic tank and manholes;
 Verify the use of fibers reinforced concrete in water containing structure (this is a research based exercise);
 Design steel type forms (with fabrication drawings) for casting of septic tanks and manholes;
 Supervise the fabrication of the first model of form of septic tank and manhole;
 Supervise the steel laying, the concrete mixing and casting for the first model of septic tank and manhole;
 Provide complete document including procedures and specifications for material, concrete mix, concrete casting and curing, and
testing;
 Prepare a brief about the products (sizing, capacity, material specification, handling and transportation, site preparation).
Position held: Consultant / Design Engineer', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sara', 'last_name': 'Elkhalifa', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Environment, Climate Change Adaptation (CCA), Development, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Security,  Climate-induced Mobility'}]}, {'title': 'Promotion of Durable solutions in Darfur, Kordofan and Blue Nile States, Sudan  Year: 2020 to date', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'Promotion of Durable solutions in Darfur, Kordofan and Blue Nile States, Sudan

Durable solution project to support the internally displaced persons (IDPs) and returnees through construction and rehabilitation of basic infrastructures, water, sanitation facilities, capacity building, livelihood, and community stabilization in seven localities that are considered border and/ or returnees areas.

•	Proposing of action plans.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sara', 'last_name': 'Elkhalifa', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Environment, Climate Change Adaptation (CCA), Development, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Security,  Climate-induced Mobility'}]}, {'title': 'Environmental and Social Impact Assessment For Meat factory', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'Main project features:
The study has been prepared as part of the Consultant’s scope for the feasibility study for establishing a state-of-the-art for integrated meat production compound in North Kurdufan State, Sudan. The project is envisaged to produce, process and market
high quality red meat (cattle, sheep and camels) meeting international standards.
To fulfill the requirements of the study, the Consultant visited the project location, Elindiraba Administrative unit, Jabrat El Shiekh
locality, North Kurdufan to evaluate the baseline conditions. Moreover, the Consultant carried out interviews with stakeholders to
identify social issues related to the project.
As the specific location of the project was not yet fully finalized, baseline aspects that were studied mainly relate to the location of
the facility. Emphasis was placed on the general environmental and social impacts upon construction and consequent full operation
of the new project.

Main project features:
The assessment was generally prepared to define the significant environmental aspects and impacts from the sites’ facilities;
including the leaks and spillage from the storage and fueling facilities, underground facilities (storage tanks).
During the project period Kush conducted two site visits, the first one for data collection, interviews, and collection of surface water,
wastewater, ground water, and soil samples..
The Environmental Site Assessment Report was prepared by Kush to identify and evaluate the environmental conditions and
aspects, providing sufficient information regarding to the nature and extent of contamination. Furthermore, the report was intended
to provide the decision makers with applicable recommendations and remediation measures, together with the cost estimation of the
selected remediation method.

Main project features:
The objective of this project is to provide Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) consultancy services for development of HSE
procedures for an entire oil exploration and production company with all supporting facilities in accordance to Occupational Health &
Safety Advisory Services (OHSAS), Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), European standards and UNEP HSE
Guidelines for Oil and Gas Exploration and Production.
During the project period Kush conducted site visits to PDOC facilities at Palogue, Adar, Gumry, and Moleta fields (Upper Nile
State), Aljabalyn central Processing facility (White Nile State), and Port Sudan marine terminal (Red Sea State) to collect the data
about PDOC operations and activities.
Position held: Project Coordinator / HSE Engineer
Activities performed:
 Liaison and coordination with client;
 Development of Health, Safety and Environment prcedures;
 Preparation of progress reports;
 Coordinate between the team members to ensure efficiency and effectiveness;

project;
 To assist the Project Manager in all aspects related to management of the project. Thus ensuring proper control of time, cost and
quality', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sara', 'last_name': 'Elkhalifa', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Environment, Climate Change Adaptation (CCA), Development, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Security,  Climate-induced Mobility'}]}, {'title': 'Environmental Site Assessment (ESA) ', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'Location: Sudan
Year: 2009-2010
Client: PETRONAS/ UNAMID, Sudan
Main project features:
The assessment was generally prepared to define the significant environmental aspects and impacts from the seven sites’ facilities;
including the leaks and spillage from the storage and fueling facilities, underground facilities (storage tanks).
During the project period Kush conducted two site visits to Darfur Region, the first one for data collection, interviews, and collection
of surface water, wastewater, ground water, and soil samples. The second visit was conducted to Alfashir for the presentation of the
ESA report findings.
The Environmental Site Assessment Report was prepared by Kush to identify and evaluate the environmental conditions and
aspects, providing sufficient information regarding to the nature and extent of contamination. The report is also intended to identify
due diligence and separate liabilities between the current operator (PMSL) and the previous operator. Furthermore, the report was
intended to provide the decision makers with applicable recommendations and remediation measures, together with the cost
estimation of the selected remediation method.
Position held: Environmental Engineer
Activities performed:
 Identify and evaluate the environmental conditions and aspects, providing sufficient information regarding to the nature and extent
of contamination;
 Interpretation of the lab results;
 Identification of due diligence and separate liabilities between the current operator (PMSL) and the previous operator;
 Remediation recommendation for the client.
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sara', 'last_name': 'Elkhalifa', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Environment, Climate Change Adaptation (CCA), Development, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Security,  Climate-induced Mobility'}]}, {'title': 'Specific Waste Management Plans', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'Location: Sudan
Client: Petrodar Operating Company
Main project features:
The study seeks to understand the existing waste management practices at each facility and to make specific requirements to
improve these practices if required through the development of PDOC waste management strategy and PDOC specific waste
management plans according to the following:
 Study, analysis and delivery of a comprehensive report on the adequacy of the existing PDOC waste management system for all
types of waste from all types of facilities operated by PDOC.
 Propose a comprehensive detailed Specific Waste Management plans (strategy) covering waste handling, waste reuse, waste
recycling, waste treatment, and waste transport and disposal requirements.
 Preparation of a hazardous waste management plan for the management of hazardous wastes, including drilling and production
chemical waste management, radioactive wastes and hazardous biological wastes.
 Propose the technical specifications, capacity and operating procedures and any other relevant information on recommended
hazardous waste equipment to be used in the treatment or disposal of hazardous wastes.
 Provision of detailed design for the proposed engineering landfills.
 Provision of waste management plans for spilled crude oil and, used oil and lubricants.
Position held: Environmental Engineer
Activities performed:
 Provision of a domestic waste management plan for the various domestic solid waste streams produced;
 Identification of KPI’s for the waste management plans
 Recommendations on waste minimization initiatives to reduce the amount of waste produced at each site;
 Provision of an overall estimation of the amount of waste generated currently;
 Provision of a 5 year forecast for waste generation from all facilities;', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sara', 'last_name': 'Elkhalifa', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Environment, Climate Change Adaptation (CCA), Development, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Climate Security,  Climate-induced Mobility'}]}]

[{'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'British Embassy - Foreign Commonwealth and Development Office ', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Khartoum, Khartoum State, Sudan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'British Embassy - Foreign Commonwealth and Development Office ', 'description': "- Play a key role in the development and delivery of the British Embassy in Khartoum’s climate, environment and water programmes and policy iniatives.

- Take on and develop collaborative relationships with Government of Sudan (GoS) in line with UK ODA principles, other donors, international development partners and private sector actors to support development and implementation of climate smart policymaking and initiatives.
- Supporting Sudan’s efforts to access and effectively delveir international climate finance, both leveraging core UK Technical Assistance and programming as well as influencing wider programming. This includes contributing to a strategy to enhance support for state level water provision through creative partnerships between federal, state authorities and international partners.
- Oversight and monitoring of water programming. This includes constructive working relationships with implementing partners, robust programme management, and adherrence to FCDO’s compliance requirements.
- Work closely with the Climate and Environment Advisor to draw on HQ level thinking and best practice and support the Peace, Economic Reform and Humanitarian Teams as the embassy increase its climate focus.
